intro: Sideranthus turbinellus, commonly known as the turbanflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, turban-shaped blooms that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sideranthus turbinellus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun.
